title: penarth library reopens refurbishment
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityFunded jointly by the Vale of Glamorgan Council and Welsh Government, the redecorated ground floor includes new furniture, enquiry desk, carpet and shelving.LED lighting has been installed throughout the building, which has also seen many of its features revived.The new entrance foyer reflects the libraryrsquos traditional architecture, while a commemorative plaque, Samuel Thomas bust and original tiles have all been restored.Additional repairs to the roof around the clock tower have also been carried out.As with other Vale of Glamorgan libraries, a number of Covid-related safety features have been introduced to help protect visitors.There are -minute book browsing sessions available along with -minute slots for computer use, which must be booked in advance by contacting the respective library.Fixed time limits will also mean staff can properly sanitise machines between uses.There are also plans to temporarily move some of the childrenrsquos stock and services to Penarth Pier Pavilion.MORE NEWS:This is so that the regular programme of childrenrsquos activities, including Rhyme  Sign and Story Times, can take place in a larger space this summer.More information about this will be provided through Penarth Libraryrsquos social media accounts in the coming weeks.Cllr Lis Burnett, Vale of Glamorgan Council Cabinet member for Education and Regeneration said: ldquoPenarth Library has undergone comprehensive upgrading work and I canrsquot wait for people to see the changes.ldquoMany of the traditional features have been restored and some new touches have also been added.ldquoPenarth, along with other Vale libraries, is now open again to the public after a range of measures were introduced to keep people safe.     Library services were initially suspended in an effort to tackle the coronavirus before a click-and-collect service was launched in late June.That allows members to borrow books, audiobooks and DVDs on an appointment basis and submit preference requests relating to authors or genres.For the time being, chairs have been removed from the libraries to discourage sitting, toilets will be closed to the public and there will be no meetings, activities or room bookings available.Anyone entering the building will be asked to use hand gel and complete a track and trace card giving their name and contact details.Library staff will work behind protective screens when at a desk and wear masks at other times and all books will be quarantined for  hours before being cleaned and put back into circulation.Current weekday opening times at Penarth, Barry, Llantwit Major and Cowbridge libraries are am to pm and pm to pmThe Libraries are also open from am untilpm, and pm untilpm on Saturdays. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: penarth man ordered repay   selling counterfeit goods
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communitySean Payter was convicted in  following a Trading Standards investigation for the Vale of Glamorgan Council and today faced a Proceeds of Crime Hearing.There the judge decided he must repay a signicant sum gained from his illegal activity over the next three months.Shared Regulatory Services , who undertake trading standards work across the Local Authority areas of Bridgend, Cardf and the Vale, began investigating Mr Payter after receiving a complaint from the Assay Office, the body responsible for testing and hallmarking precious metals.The Assay Office had carried out a test purchase from gemgems, a company operated by Payter and Stefan Hodgson from Newport, that sold jewellery on eBay.It revealed that an item was not silver as described and did not contain the advertised gem stones.Further testing by SRS found that other items of jewellery were also misdescribed and that cosmetics being sold were unsafe and possibly infringed trademarks.After executing a warrant for the home of Payter, SRS officers seized jewellery, cosmetics and pound, in cash.The investigation showed that Payter and Hodgson had been trading for five years and at one point ran a website calledgemsgems.MORE NEWS:Check out these photos of the ambitious transformation at Whitmore High SchoolNew Pathway College announced at University of South WalesOutdoor show to come to Barrys MEMO Arts Centre later this month!They had been buying items such as necklaces, bracelets, bangles and earrings from a website in China without verying that they were as described.Counterfeit cufflinks and belts were also identied along with cosmetics that werenrsquot safe to be used.Payter, from St Davids Cresent in Penarth and Hodgson, of Park Drive Newport, both plead guilty to  offences in total two under Consumer Protection from Unfair Trading Regulations, six under the Hallmarking Act, two under Cosmetic Product Enforcement Regulations and two under the Trademarks Act.     In August  they were sentenced to a total of  months in prison, reduced to  months for early guilty pleas, suspended for  months. The pair also had to pay a victim surcharge of pound each.Cllr Eddie Williams, Vale of Glamorgan Council Cabinet Member for Legal, Regulatory and Planning Services, said: ldquoThis was a despicable operation that took money from members of the public for items that were not what they purported to be."Great work by Shared Regulatory Services has led to this prosecution, which ensures that no more people will fall victim to this company.ldquoI welcome the signicant sum Mr Payter has been told to repay, which reflects the amount of money he made from the operation.ldquoThis case should serve as a warning to others operating illegally within our community. The Council will actively look to protect our residents and will not hesitate to take actionwe find people are not operating within the parameters of the law. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: mcdonalds scrap popular items menu make way  new offerings
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityFast food lovers will know, the UKrsquos most popular burger chain regularly updates its menu throughout the year with promotions to keep their offerings fresh.From this week, McDonaldrsquos has unveiled five new items that will be available to customers until mid-June.The new products will be part of the chains menu from May  to June  meaning you will only have a short time to sample their new offerings.One of the items making ais a firm favourite among McDonaldrsquos lovers, the Bacon Clubhouse Double.The burger consists of two % beef patties, two rashers of Beechwood smoked bacon, a slice of cheddar cheese, onions, tomato, lettuce, and sauce.Another item being added to the menu is the Chicken Deluxe Sandwich.A chicken option consisting of two crunchy Chicken Selects, Emmental cheese, lettuce, red onions, tomato relish, and mayonnaise. Both items will cost pound. each." alt"Penarth Times: Two new burgers will be making ato the menu. " class"editor-image"Two new burgers will be making ato the menu. Another item making ato the menu is the Cheese and Herb Melts. Priced at pound., the cheesy treats come in a pack of five and accompanied with a delicious tomato and herb sauce.McDonaldrsquos is also mixing it up with their McFlurryrsquos with Galaxy and Galaxy Caramel flavours making ato the menu.Both feature Galaxy chocolate chunks with either chocolate or caramel sauce and cost pound..Now that you have had the good news, to make way for the new items McDonaldrsquos is having to scrap a number of items that have proven popular with customers.One of which is the Big Tasty burger which was removed on May  alongside the Chicken BBQ Smokehouse burger.To make way for the Galaxy McFlurryrsquos, McDonaldrsquos has also revealed the Cadbury Cregraveme Egg and the Cadbury Caramel flavours are being scrapped.The items were reintroduced to the McDonaldrsquos menu in March when customers were warned they would only be available until May.However, with how often the menu changes it is likely customers will see them make ato the menu sometime in the future. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"Comments are closed on this article. -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: meet penarth man designed new town parklets
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityJohn Davies, owner ofCandid Creative Studio, worked with the Vale of Glamorgan Council on the parklets after taking part in a competition to design and manage the installation of artwork to celebrate Penarth.In all it took around a month to complete, from the initial conceptualisation meetings through to agreeing the final artwork.ldquoWe carefully balanced the needs for the parklets to have an identity, promote and shout about Penarth, and also appeal to the public at large, he said.Parklets are extensions of trading space built out into existing parking bays that allow businesses to safely accommodate a greater number of customers.D signs of Bridgend fitted the vinyl artwork just in time for outdoor hospitality to open on Monday, April .ldquoIt is Penarthrsquos very own unique and erse architectural heritage which formed the inspiration to the parklets artwork, he added.ldquoThe townrsquos famous landmarks, as well as some lesser known ones, join quirky seaside elements, to decorate the glass .The parklets offer a great opportunity for hospitality businesses to welcome back customers, with some shelter, while they cannot currently open inside.MORE NEWS:lsquoHe will always be in my heartrsquo: Woman raises over pound, in memory of childhood friendPenarth man ordered to repay pound, after selling counterfeit goodsCan you help  Appeal after boombox, toilet and more dumped at Vale parkThe final designed parklets can be seen outside Willmorersquos  on Stanwell Road, and Foxys Deli, Victoria Roadand Gin .ldquoOutside the business opportunities, on a sunny day they also animate Penarthrsquos streets, encourage residents and tourists to stay a little longer in the town and enjoy everything Penarth has he added.ldquoBusinesses and the public alike have enjoyed using the parklets since last week, and feedback on the artwork has been very positive.     For Mr Daviesrsquo graphic design businesses, he says the last few months since the lockdown on December  has lsquoremained steady.rsquoldquoI am very lucky to work with a range of clients ndash the NHS, national charities, ambitious locals, small businesses, and everyone in between ndash who have needed to adapt themselves to the changing landscape caused by the pandemic.ldquoThat ability to stay nimble has allowed my clients to weather the storm so far, and I am faithful that will continue as we see the pandemic in the rear view mirror. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: rnli penarth looking lifeboat station historian
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityThe role will see them revealing the stories behind the townrsquos leboat station since it re-opened in , as well as collecting information and statistics on the boats and launches.The volunteer will research and collect oral histories from the many people who have been involved with the station over the years.From past boat crew and family members to the hundreds of volunteers and people throughout the community who have come into contact with the station over the last .RNLI Penarthrsquos first leboat station was built in  for a cost of pound, before being relocated in  when Penarth Esplanade was constructed.The station closed in , and the town had no leboat station for another  years. Not until the increasing popularity of Penarth as a destination for tourism and leisure boating saw the need for leboat services to be re-established in .MORE NEWS:#The current purpose-built station was constructed in .The history of the th century station has been well-documented, but not its history since , which is what this new role will uncover.Laurie Pavelin, chair of RNLI Penarth Leboat Station, said: ldquoPenarthrsquos leboat station has been a central part of the community since , and in that time it has played a part in many peoplersquos lives.ldquoThe people of Penarth have volunteered, fundraised, attended events, brought safety lessons to schools, and played a part in RNLIrsquos lesaving work in so many dferent ways.ldquoWersquore looking forward to welcoming a new volunteer historian who will make sure those stories are preserved for the community. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: senedd election  vaughan gething retains seat
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. When we saw the boxes being opened in Penarth we also saw there was a very strong showing there."It was hard to tell how all of the votes scattered amongst the fringe parties, but in the main parties it was clear that we were going to have a good result."When asked about what is in store for next term, he said: "Well we need to see what the national results are, and Ive still got choices to make as the health minister until a new government is formed."Some of those are still big and dficult, and I think its part of the reason why people renwed their faith in us and that is because they recognise there are still challenges to navigate our way through."But I really do look forward to within tis next term being able to see people in a more normal way - to go to more community events and have more of the person to person contact weve all missed in this last year and more."This year saw a sizeable increase in voter turnout with , votes cast- . per cent - compared to . per cent in .The full results for Cardf South and Penarth are as follows:Vaughan Gething- ,Leighton Rowlands- ,Nasir Adam- ,Helen Westhead- ,Alex Wilson- ,Paul Campbell- Lisa Peregrine- Matt Friend- Alan Pick- Alan Golding- David Rolfe- Angus Hawkins-  article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentBOTH the Conservative and Plaid Cymru won two seats in the South Wales Central region.Rhys ap Owen and Heledd Fychan were elected for Plaid, with Welsh Conservative leader Andrew RT Davies retaining his seat in the region, along with Joel James.Neither Mr Davies nor Mr Jones attended the count at the Barry Memo Arts Centre today, despite the Welsh Conservatives securingtheir best ever Senedd result ndash winning  seats.On the partys overall result, Mr Davies said: ldquoFirstly, Irsquod like to say a huge thank you to our outstanding set of Welsh Conservative candidates, activists and staff whorsquove worked incredibly hard throughout this campaign and secured the partys best ever Senedd result.ldquoThe team has gone above and beyond and deserve great credit for the positive campaign wersquove run right across Wales, and I am thrilled to see Natasha Asghar make history in South Wales East by becoming the first female from a BAME background to be elected to the Senedd.ldquoAs a party we are also delighted to have secured constituency seats in the Vale of Clwyd and Brecon and Radnorshire, and increased seats on the regional lists, resulting in our highest ever representation in the Senedd with  members.ldquoItrsquos been an unconventional campaign and itrsquos clear incumbency and continuity has played a signicant part. To that end, I would like to offer my sincere congratulations to Mark Drakeford and Welsh Labour on a successful campaign.ldquoThe election has been fought in good spirit by political parties in Wales and I would like to pay a final word of thanks to the many officials across the country whorsquove allowed this election to take place in a safe and effective manner.Plaid Cymru gained an extra seat this election, which was occupied by Ukip in , secured  seats in the Senedd in total and meant Labour fell short of a majority in Wales.Speaking on the win, Heledd Fychan of Plaid Cymru said she feels ldquoincredibly honoured, humbled and excited and that there will be a lot of ldquoreading and preparing in the coming days.     Spoke with @heleddfychan after Plaid secured two seats at the South Wales Central counts #SeneddVote pic GKeJwmdash BrookeMay , ldquoI know the first thing that I want to focus on in the Senedd is fighting for independent inquiry into the  floods that devastated communities from the Vale of Glamorgan right to the Cynon Valley.ldquoSo thatrsquos definitely one of my first priorities.ldquoGiven that we werenrsquot able to campaign until April  or knock any doors Irsquom extremely proud that wersquove achieved an increase in number of members we have in the Senedd.Heledd Fychan of Plaid Cymru after being elected to the Senedd for the South Wales Central seat at the Senedd election count at Memo Arts Centre in Barry. Picture: Huw Evans Picture AgencyldquoPersonally in Pontypridd we raised the vote by four percent, which I was incredibly proud of and I think the fact that we have so many new, fresh faces coming to the Senedd means that there is a lot of excitement about what we will be able to achieve as a group.Mr ap Owen added: "Its sinking in now slowly. It always looked likely that we were going to get regional seats here in South Wales Central but we dont quite believe it until it actually happens."Rhys ap Owen of Plaid Cymru after being elected to the Senedd for the South Wales Central seat at the Senedd election count at Memo Arts Centre in Barry. Picture: Huw Evans Picture AgencyHe says that campaigning during the coronavirus pandemic has been "dficult" and "unusual.""Usually we would be knocking doors for well over a year before an election and we havent been able to do that so it has been a very dferent election to any I have experienced."The full results are below:Welsh Labour ndash ,Welsh Conservatives ndash ,Plaid Cymru - ,Wales Green Party ndash ,Welsh Liberal Democrats ndash ,Abolish the Welsh Assembly Party - ,Propel - ,Ukip - Scrap the Assembly Senedd ndash ,Reform UK - ,No More Lockdowns - ,Gwlad - The Welsh Independence Party - ,Britains Communist Party - Alan Coulthard ndash Trade Unionist and Socialist Coalition - Workers Party ndash  article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: labours alun michael re elected south wales pcc
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityAlun Michael" Labours Alun Michael re-elected as South Wales PCC for third timeAlun Edward Michael" Skip to next photo Show caption  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl" href" my account emailthispage " s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentALUN Michael has been re-elected as the Police and Crime Commissioner for South Wales.The Welsh Labour politician has been serving as the PCC since the role was created in , and will continue to do so for another four years after winning  per cent of the total vote.Conservative candidate Steve Gallagher came in second with  per cent.Among first preference votes, Mr Michael received , ndash or . percent ndash falling short of the  per cent needed to win re-election.Alun Michael speaking after his winOnce the top two were confirmed, the second preference votes were counted ndash those whose first choice was eliminated ndash which saw Mr Michael elected with , votes, and Steve Gallagher had ,.Speaking on his win, Mr Michael said: ldquoItrsquos been a very strange election, coming as it does in the period of Covid-.ldquoSo my first thanks are to the other candidates who have shown stamina through that period.MORE NEWS:ldquoWe took part in a number of speech debates and they were constructed exchanges about things that matter to the electorate of South Wales.ldquoThank you to all the staff who have been involved in the count, including the police officers who have been here to deal with any outbreaks but fortunately they havenrsquot had to deal with.ldquoYou have all shown incredible stamina throughout the last few days with the challenges of the count in this period of Covid-.ldquoAnd thank you in particular to the electorate of South Wales across the  constituencies. I take very seriously indeed the responsibilities the votes cast today place on my shoulders in trying to deliver and to continue to improve the effectiveness of policing.ldquoMy commitment is to do that with renewed energy.     The job of a PCC is to oversee how crime is tackled in their area. They hold their forces to account and set local force priorities and budgets. They also scrutinise the chief constable with the power to appoint and dismiss them.They also work with local partners to prevent crime. The hope is that their democratic mandate from the public makes them more accountable and able to respond to local peoplersquos concerns.First preference votes:Second preference votes:Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: can say penarth e bike expansion
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityWhen the fleet of  e-bikes and five stations was launched in November last year thanks to funding from The Vale of Glamorgan Council, it became the first public electric bike share scheme in Wales.Now thanks to its success, funding has been made available to expand the scheme into Dinas Powys.An online public consultation is being launched by nextbike today , where people can say where they would like to see a station installed and why.Nextbike UK MD, Krysia Solheeim, said: ldquoThe scheme has proved incredibly popular to date, with more than , journeys made and , km cycled so far."Thanks to its success, we want to expand the station network to allow convenient access to even more people.ldquoBike share schemes can have such a positive impact on peoplersquos lives in many ways, from the physical and mental health benefits that cycling brings, to the reduction in congestion and CO emissions that comes from cycling instead of using motorised transport.MORE NEWS:ldquoWersquore really keen to hear from the public about where they would like to see the new stations situated. Our bike share schemes are there to benefit the whole community, which is why we want to hear from as many people as possible.Nextbike docking stations have to be close to popular destinations such as existing transport links, job centres, supermarkets and other shops be in an area of high footfall be highly visible and easy to find have enough space to allow safe movement of pedestrians and people with limited mobility and be accessible by van or bike trailer to allow the nextbike service team to maintain the bikes and stations.     Final decisions will be made based on the above criteria, in addition to the ability to get power to the locations, which is determined by power providers.Councillor Peter King, Cabinet Member for Neighbourhood Services and Transport Vale of Glamorgan Council, said: ldquoThe nextbike e-bike hire scheme in Penarth has proved extremely successful."Since its launch, the hire of the bikes has been steadily increasing.ldquoWith the onset of summer, we have implemented a new docking station at Cosmeston, and very soon there will be a new docking station in Sully."I am convinced the scheme will only go from strength to strength.ldquoTwo additional docking stations in Dinas Powys will complement the existing nextbike network within the Vale of Glamorgan and provide an additional sustainable transport link between these three areas."I would encourage Dinas Powys residents to respond to the consultation as itrsquos important they are located where they are accessible to as many people as possible.Penarthrsquos existing stations are located at the Esplanade, Llandough Hospital, Windsor Road, Penarth Train Station, the Barrage and the recently-installed Cosmeston.While the Penarth bikes can currently only be rented and ed to Penarth stations, the ambition is to eventually link the scheme to nextbikersquos Cardf fleet, meaning commuters will be able to use the e-bikes to make the journey between the town and the city with ease.E-bikes are a combination of a conventional bike with a motor that take some of the effort out of pedalling for the rider. With top speeds of km per hour, the e-bikes can cover greater distances in less time and with less effort than conventional cycles.E-bike rental costs pound per  minutes for customers with a monthly or annual membership, or pound per  minutes on a pay as you ride basis.The consultation runs until May . To take part, visitwww.nextbike en dinas-powysor get in touch with suggestions on social media via @nextbikeUK. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityThe Welsh Government and NHS Wales are providing around  oxygen concentrators and more than  ventilators which are due to leave for India in the coming days.Health minister Vaughan Gething said: ldquoCovid- is a global threat and as such it is right that we are part of the global response, supporting other nations.ldquoWe have worked closely with the UK Government and the Government of India on the logistics in arranging for these supplies to be transported to India and distributed to the hospitals where they are needed most.Mr Gething and chairman of Waless branch of the British Association of Physicians of Indian OriginProfessor Keshav Singhal visited the NHS Wales National Distribution Centre on Monday, May , to inspect the supplies.MORE NEWS:Flights are being arranged by the Foreign Commonwealth and Development Office. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: hundreds thousands spent two roads vale now wont get built
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityFor several years Vale of Glamorgan council was drawing up plans to build a road from the A to the M, and another road bypassing Dinas Powys.But last month the Welsh Government announced it would not fund building these new roads, as part of its new transport strategy which focuses on public and active transport.Now the Vale council has revealed the total cost spent on these two roads which have now been cancelled: pound,.More NewsLabours Alun Michael re-elected as South Wales PCCDisruption on train lines between Wales and London todayLook whorsquos just been in court from Barry and St AthanThe costs include hiring consultants to draw up plans for where the roads would potentially go, as well as y public consultation to seethere were support for them.The road from the A at Sycamore Cross to the M at Junction  proved highly unpopular as concerns ranged from houses getting knocked down to ancient woodland felled.That road has cost pound,, which was funded by grants from the Welsh Government.The road bypassing Dinas Powys however was generally supported by the public, and was part of a wider project to improve transport infrastructure in the village like better bus shelters and cycling routes. The bypass could have cut congestion in Dinas too, a current problem.The wider Dinas transport project has cost pound,, mostly from Welsh Government, but including pound, from the Vale council.Councillor Peter King, cabinet member for transport, said: ldquoWelsh Government is moving very much away from road building into tackling climate change, which I really find some dficulty objecting to.ldquoIt has always frustrated me that the work was seen as the Dinas Powys bypass. But it wasnrsquot mdash it was the Dinas Powys transport infrastructure, because it included all sorts of things, including cycle networks and better access to train stations.     He revealed the costs during a meeting of the full council on Monday, April , after a question from Cllr Ian Johnson, leader of the Plaid Cymru group on the Vale.However some of the wider works to improve transport around Dinas could still be funded where, like from the Cardf Capital Region, a body of  councils across south-east Wales. One project that could go ahead includes a cycle route from Newport to Barry.Cllr King said: ldquoWe think we can probably pursue some of [wider work] through the city region, and we have also been awarded money for the active travel Newport to Barry route. So some of the other elements of the transport infrastructure we can pursue.ldquoBut wersquoll wait until after the election [on May ] to see whorsquos in charge, before we decide what to do next. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: laurence llewelyn bowen joins campaign transform plas llanmihangel
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityOne of the finest and most complete early gentry houses in the Vale of Glamorgan, Plas Llanmihangel is currently on the market for pound. million. Rather than see it go into private occupancy, Connect to Purpose aims to purchase and restore the Grade  listed fortiedmanor house, and turn it into a safe and tranquil retreat fordisadvantaged young people and their families from across South Wales.Help and support offered to families will include personal development coaching, health and wellbeing therapies, education and creative arts , as well as opportunities to commune with nature in the surrounding countryside and play their part in the conservation of the manor.Plas Llanmihangel. Picture: Trip AdvisorThecharity also intends to share the unique historic home with the wider community, byoffering bed and breakfast, and holiday rental accommodation for public use delivering wellbeing retreats and open days, and holding an annual medieval festival of arts.MORE NEWS:Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen, said: "I was lucky enough to fall in love with Plas Llanmihangel over a decade ago, filming its fairytale gothic glory for the BBC series lsquoHidden Houses of Walesrsquo."What struck me then, and gives me so much pleasure now, is the fact that this building is such a powerful time capsule, with the ability to take visitors back to so many dferent, extremely important, moments that defined the history of Wales and indeed the history of the UK."With this in mind I am compelled to support this extraordinarily exciting initiative to revivy one of my favourite Welsh buildings and use it to help young people learn the skills they need to create the kind of le for themselves that they desire.     In order to purchase Plas Llanmihangel, the charity has launched acrowdfunding page.Trustee of Connect to Purpose, Georgina Saralis, said: ldquoOur aim is to save and sympathetically restore this spectacular property and create a comfortable family home to be shared with the local community and visitors alike."Through a programme of education, therapy, creative arts and coaching, we will offer disadvantaged young people and their families the support, time and space needed to find a way through their dficulties.To find out more about the project, visitwww.plasllanmihangel. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. His teacher is really good and lovely.ldquoThe whole family enjoys music, but none of play an instrument like Charlie. Hersquos been playing classical piano since he was seven, but has self-taught himself music like blues, boogie woogie and rock lsquonrsquo roll.You can watch the video on Facebook here.OTHER NEWS:Charlie, who is currently doing his GCSEs, taught himself other genres of music through YouTube videos and often entertains his family with musical numbers on his electric piano.A performance he gave at Barrys Memo Arts Centre when he was  went down a storm according to Ms Wilson, who hopes hell have the opportunity to perform live in future.His classical piano teacher is from Razzle Dazzle Theatre School. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityThe mayor holds a ceremonial role, representing the council in public events, and chairing meetings of the council. The post is usually held for a year. It is a separate position from the council leader.The annual general meeting of the council was the first to be broadcast live online since the start of the coronavirus pandemic.The council had previously been uploading recordings of public meetings days after they were held, but faced criticism for the delays.MORE NEWS:The mayor was nominated for re-election by her party colleague Cllr Gwyn John, who said: ldquoCllr Jayne Norman has been on this council since ."She has worked very hard over the last year and previous years as a councillor.ldquoBut last year in her role as mayor, it has been extremely dficult for her and wersquore absolutely delighted to nominate her to continue her role as mayor."Irsquom sure Cllr Norman this year will be able to carry out her duties to excellence.On being re-elected, she said: ldquoThank you to all for my appointment. I hope this year will see us get back to as close as possible to normal.Cllr Rhiannon Birch was also elected as deputy mayor. The Labour councillor is also leader of Penarth Town Council.The councilrsquos leader, deputy leader, and cabinet remain unchanged this year. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: penarth rfc pay tribute lovely human being
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityBorn in Penarth in , Stu, one of the four sons of local man Len Davies, went to St Joseph School, where he started playing rugby, together with the current club president John Davey.After school, he joined the Royal Navy, where he spent his entire rugby playing career aboard HMS Bulwark, HMS Raleigh, HMS Devonshire and HMS Centaur, the later as captain of the first XV.He ed to civilian le in , when he joined the marine department of Cardf Port Authority as operations manager.During his time with the Port Authority he met again his old school friend John Davey, at the time the supervisor of the Port Cargo operations and also the secretary of Penarth RFC.John talked his old school friend into joining the Penarth RFC club committee, taking over as kit manager, a position he retained for the following  years, before the outbreak of the coronavirus epidemic.In due course, Stu Davies became the clubrsquos main statistician, having managed to compile the post-war club database, which is now widely used by the club.ldquoWithout his extraordinary comprehensive and accurate work, the volume The Spirit of Penarth would have never been published, said author and former club secretary Chris Thau.Former Penarth RFC chairman Mike Gooding has described Stu as one of the kindest and most considerate men he had the privilege to deal with in his entire playing and administrative career with the seaside club.He said: ldquoI cannot imagine the club without him, somewhere in the background, with his little notebook keeping track of scores and scorers."Stuart was a proper gentlemen and I have not met anybody who could say a bad word about him."He was a lovely human being, full of compassion and humanity. He was just one of a kind and will be sorely missed.     Stuart was a good family man. He married Janet, a NHS nurse, and they had a wonderful daughter Rhinna, whom he absolutely adored.Sadly, during the last couple of years his health had deteriorated, though he made brave efforts to carry on trying to help the struggling rugby club. At the end of October he had a stroke while driving his car and ended up in hospital, where the Covid- lockdown prevented him from seeing his family for several months, which left him very upset and both Janet and Rhinna heartbroken. ldquoHe lost ten stones in weight and seemed to have aged  years in  days, explained his daughter.Thankfully, he was determined to see his loved ones and say goodbye, as Rhinna explained, so he resolutely battled against the odds, making sure he was able to see them by the end of April when the lockdown was relaxed.ldquoHe has waited for us," said Rhinna. "We went to see him and mum said that he was waiting for us and his brother Keith to say goodbye.There is very little doubt Penarth RFC will never be the same without Stu Davies. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: coronavirus one three adults wales fully vaccinated
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityAs of Tuesday,  per cent of Welsh adults have now received their first dose of the vaccinewhile , second doses have also been administered."I am extremely grateful to all our NHS colleagues and all the volunteers across Wales whose continuous hard work and dedication is making our excellent progress through our COVID- vaccination programme possible," said health minister Vaughan Gething."Soon we will have given two million first doses and one million second doses, which is truly phenomenal progress in our fight against Covid-.":Earlier this week, the Joint Committee on Vaccination and Immunisationsaid, as a precautionary measure, people under  with no clinical risk factors who are not yet vaccinated, should be offered an alternate to Oxford AstraZeneca vaccine."We have immediately implemented this change into our programme," said Mr Gething."The appropriate vaccine will be made available at peoplersquos appointments."We do not envisage that this will lead to a delay to the roll out of our vaccine programme in Wales. We are continuing to work towards the third milestone set out in our strategy, which is to offer a vaccine to everyone aged  and over by July ."As we have regularly statedvaccine supply allows us to move faster than we will do so."Everybody who has already had a first dose of the AstraZeneca vaccine should be reassured that they should receive a second dose of the same brand, irrespective of age, in line with JCVI advice. Medical exemptions may apply to a very small minority."The AstraZeneca vaccine has already saved thousands of lives and remains safe and effective for the majority of the population. Over .million people have received the AstraZeneca vaccine in Wales since January, with very few cases of the rare clotting with thrombocytopenia event."     What to doyou havent had your appointmentPeople in the Aneurin Bevan University Health Board region who have not yet received their vaccination appointment have been encouraged to contact the health board.If you received a first dose of Pfizer vaccine between December  and the end of February but have not received notication of second dose, you should complete the form at abuhb.nhs.wales coronavirus covid--vaccineFor people who had an AstraZeneca first dose between January  and February  but not received notication of second dose, they should also complete a form at the website above.If you are aged  and above and have not received your Covid- vaccination appointment, visit the aged  and above section of the vaccine page on the health board website.If you are clinically extremely vulnerable or have underlying health conditions that would classy you as priority group  or  under the JCVI guidance, contact your GP practiceyou have not received a vaccination invitation. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: traffic levels vale glamorgan start creep lockdown rules relax
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityLast year saw the fewest miles driven on the arearsquos roads by motorists since , when records began .But any respite in traffic levels will soon be over, says the RAC, which predicts a busy summer on the roads as restrictions are eased.Data from the Department for Transport shows cars and taxis covered an estimated  million miles on the Vale of Glamorganrsquos roads during .More NewsCoronavirus: case rates suppressed in the ValePenarth RFC pay tribute to lsquolovely human beingrsquoMayor of Vale of Glamorgan re-elected for second termThat was  per cent fewer than in  when  million miles were covered.It was a similar picture across Great Britain with the number of miles of car journeys down  per cent.The DfT said the figures were heavily impacted by the effects of the coronavirus, with restrictions on travel in place through many months of last year.Yet early indications from the Government show traffic couldto  levels as lockdown is eased.And the RAC has said it has already noticed an increase in vehicles on the road this year, adding it expected a busy summer.Nicholas Lyes, head of policy, said: ldquoWith traffic now creeping back up to near-normal levels and restrictions due to ease further in the next few weeks, we expect it to be a busy summer on the roads.But the Confederation of Passenger Transport UK, a group which represents the bus and coach industry, says it hopes people do notto their cars.The group wants the country to avoid a ldquocar-based recovery. Instead, it hopes to encourage people to use public transport.Alison Edwards, head of policy at the group, said: ldquoThis means ensuring that public transport is not left behind other areas of the economy in the ongoing social distancing review and ministers overtly encouraging people back onto buses and coaches.     ldquoWithout this we will see greater congestion slowing our economic recovery along with worsening air quality and increased carbon emissions.However, the RAC said its research had showed lockdown had strengthened the importance people place in owning a car.The figures from the DfT also show car travel made up  per cent of all road miles in the Vale of Glamorgan in , with lorries and commercial vans making up the rest.The total milage for all traffic was  million miles, down  per cent from  million miles in .The DfT said a fall in the number of miles driven on the countryrsquos roads had coincided with fewer accidents and faster journey times on major roads.A spokesperson said work was being done with transport operators to ensure ldquogood levels of service as the pandemic eases. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: eluned morgan replaces vaughan gething wales health minister

These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityMark Drakeford was sworn in as First Minister earlier today and has now issued a reshuffling of Welsh Governments cabinet - in a surprise move Eluned Morgan has replaced Vaughan Gething as Wales health minister.Mr Gething - who had been in his previous post of Wales health minister for five years - has been appointed as Wales economy minister, replacing Ken Skates who is leaving the government.Mr Skates had also been in his post for five years.Announcing the decision, First Minister Mark Drakeford said: ldquoKen has been a real strength in Cabinet and a voice for North Wales. He will continue speaking up for North Wales and for Welsh Labour, but in a dferent role. We will miss his energy and passion.ldquoVaughan becomes Economy Minister at a crucial point in time ndash the pandemic is not just a public health emergency but also an economic one.Jeremy Miles will be involved with education. Julie James has also been appointed to a new cabinet role as minister for climate change, with Lee Waters as her deputy.The new cabinet is expected to meet soon to finalise Fridays coronavirus lockdown restrictions review. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: covid  indian variant hotspots uk revealed
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityWhile Covid- cases in most areas of the UK are at their lowest levels since August last year,there are concerns the Indian iant could see cases jump back up.Data from Public Health Englandshows a rise in cases from  to , this week in the UK, with the agency saying cases were ldquorising in the community and it was assessing the impact and severity of the iant.One response being considered is bringing forward the date for a second dose of vaccine for eligible groups to increase protection.Health Secretary Matt Hancock said the situation was being monitored carefully and the Government ldquowill not hesitate to take further actionnecessary.However, a small number of areas are seeing a rise in cases as the India iant spreads across the UK.The Prime Minister has said there is "increasing concern" about the iant and warned the emergence of further new iants "pose a potentially lethal danger".Where is the India iant dominant Surge testing has been under way in parts of Bolton since  May, after Public Health Englandconfirmed the town is one of the main locations of the India iant, which was reclassied as a lsquoiant of concernrsquo last week.Cases of the iant in England increased from  to  as of  May, according to PHE figures, with almost half of these related to travel or contact with a traveller.The majority of cases of the India Covid strain are concentrated in the north-west of England, predominantly in Bolton, and in London.The iant is also thought to be the reason behind half of coronavirus infections in Bedford, Blackburn with Darwen and South Northamptonshire, although these outbreaks are still small.Greater Manchester Mayor Andy Burnham has submitted a request to the Joint Committee on Vaccination and Immunisation that all over-s in Bolton, along with the rest of the Greater Manchester area, are able to receive a Covid- vaccination ldquoto mitigate the risks of spread in those communities where we are seeing more transmission.     There are also around  to  cases of the India iant in parts of Scotland, including Glasgow, with these cases again connected to travel.The India Covid iant, officially known as B.., was first detected in India in October.It has been designated a ldquoiant of concern by PHE as it is thought to be at least as transmissible as the iant detected in Kent last year, known as B, which is now dominant in the UK.PHE said there is currently no evidence to suggest that the new Indian iant is more serious than previous mutations, nor is there evidence which indicates that this version of the Indian iant is resistant to current vaccines.Health experts said they ldquohavenrsquot seen any hint of a current Covid iant that can fully evade the effectiveness of vaccines.On Wednesday , the European Medicines Agency said it was ldquopretty confident that vaccines currently in use will be effective against the Indian iant, a view that has been echoed by some British scientists.However, Professor James Naismith from the University of Oxford said not enough is known to say for sure whether the iant could frustrate the UKrsquos vaccination programme.Speaking on BBC Radio rsquos Today programme, he said: ldquoThe vaccines donrsquot  per cent prevent infection for people.ldquoWhat they do is, they almost  per cent prevent hospitalisation and serious illness.ldquoWe donrsquot know enough to know yet whether the Indian strain will behave dferently than that.ldquoSo even the regular virus can infect people who have been vaccinated and sometimes you do get reinfection.Could the iant delay lockdown ending The growing number of India Covid iant cases in the UK has sparked concerns that the lting of lockdown restrictions, which is set for  June in England, could now be delayed.Ministers have also not ruled out re-introducing local lockdowns in areas where the iant of concern is increasing.Foreign Office minister James Cleverly said that the government will make decisions based on the data, and measures will be eased ldquoat a pace and in a way which is safe.Symptoms to look forThe main symptoms of coronavirus to look for include:a high temperature ndash this means you feel hot to touch on your chest or back a new, continuous cough ndash this means coughing a lot for more than an hour, or three or more coughing episodes in  hours a loss or change to your sense of smell or taste ndash this means youve noticed you cannot smell or taste anything, or things smell or taste dferent to normalMost people with symptoms have at least one of these symptoms, although some do not experience any. As such, it is advised that everyone gets tested regularly to help prevent further spread of the virus. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"Comments are closed on this article. -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: friends reunion premiere date confirmed celebrity guests announced

I feel so blessed to have had a chance to reunite with my Friendshellip and it was better than ever., px px  rgba margin:  auto max-width:px padding: width:.% width:-webkit-calc width: auto" display:block height:px margin: auto -px position:relative top:-px width:px"LoadingA post shared by Courteney Cox  View on Instagram@-webkit-keyframes"dkaXkpbBxI" % %@keyframes"dkaXkpbBxI" % % ldquoFinally! Had a blast with the cast and a solid nap with LeBlanc, said Schwimmer, who played palaeontologist Ross Geller.Aniston, best known as Rachel Green, said: ldquoItrsquos official! The #FriendsReunion premieres May th on @HBOMax mdash could we BE any more excited !ldquoSo great to see you everyone, wrote LeBlanc, who played hapless actor Joey Tribbiani.HBO has also unveiled a star-studded line-up of celebrities who will appear as themselves.They include David Beckham, Justin Bieber, BTS, James Corden, Cindy Crawford, Cara Delevingne, Lady Gaga,Kit Harington, Tom Selleck, Reese Witherspoon and Malala Yousafzai.The cast will not be in character and will appear as themselves in the special, which was repeatedly delayed because of the pandemic after originally being set to arrive on the HBO Max streaming  in May last year. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"Comments are closed on this article. -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: three five workers say pre school children behind early development
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityNearly halfof staff who work with pre-school children believe the attainment gap between poorer under-fives and their more affluent peers has grown during the pandemic, the Early Years Alliancefound.A poll of more than , workers in nurseries, pre-schools and childminding settings in England found that % say fewer children from all backgrounds are meeting the expected level of attainment in the prime areas of learning and development since the start of the coronavirus pandemic.More than halfsaid they had observed negative changes in childrenrsquos learning and development when they ed after the first lockdown.One respondent said youngsters had forgotten how to put on their own shoes, while another said some pre-schoolers now look at toys ldquoblankly and do not know how to use their imaginations and play.Of those who saw negative changes, % said these were more evident in children from more economically disadvantaged backgrounds.Childrenrsquos personal, social and emotional development, as well as their communication and language development, have been particularly affected by the pandemic, according to early years workers.One respondent to the survey said youngsters are now ldquoclingy, upset and afraid of strangers following lockdown periods.They added: ldquoThey have lost the ability to play independently. They are taking a long time to settle away from their parents.ldquoSome have ed with very good literacy and numeracy skills but are nowhere near where they should be with personal, social and emotional development, or physical and self-care skills.ldquoThey are lacking in gross motor skills because they have been indoors a lot, and some who could put on their own shoes before lockdown have forgotten how.     Another respondent said: ldquoThey look at toys and loose parts blankly, with no idea how to explore and use their imaginations.ldquoThey often ask for the TV or to play with my phone and are confused when I tell them lsquonorsquo.ldquoI worry about what this year has done to their development and how long it will take to make up for lost learning.One respondent said: ldquoThe only thing preventing us from delivering all the interventions we would like to be able to deliver is a lack of finances.ldquoWe are running with the minimum level of staff to meet the statutory requirements, because we cannot afford to pay additional staff.ldquoMore staff would enable more, and more effective, interventions which would have a huge impact on the learning and development of all our children but particularly those that are currently under-achieving.More than four in fiverespondents said the Government is not doing enough to support early years providers to tackle the impact of the pandemic on under-fives, with many citing a lack of adequate financial resources and an inability to invest in additional staff to offer targeted support.Prime Minister Boris Johnson has already made pound. billion of catch-up funding available in England to help children who have faced disruption to their education due to Covid-.Only pound million of this package will go towards supporting early language development in pre-reception settings, while a further pound million will be available to schools for children in reception classes.EYA chief executive Neil Leitch said: ldquoPractitioners responding to the survey said they know exactly what children at their settings most need to recover lost skills and confidence, and that the only thing stopping them from taking action is a lack of resources.ldquoIt is therefore vital that nurseries, pre-schools and childminders are given dedicated financial support for recovery, and the autonomy to use it as they see fit.ldquoProper funding would enable the targeted interventions needed to improve childrenrsquos personal, social and emotional development alongside their physical development, which many respondents noted have suffered as a result of being cut off from their friends and opportunities to play and explore.ldquoGiven the proven link between investment in early years and better educational and social outcomes, especially for the most disadvantaged children, a failure to invest now would be unforgivable.On Friday, the Department for Educationencouraged all state schools in England with a reception class to apply for resources and training as part of its pound million early years catch-up programme.It is hoped the scheme will raise the outcomes in Reception-age childrenrsquos early language, communication and speech skills.Children and Families Minister Vicky Ford said: ldquoWe know the first years of a childrsquos le can be the most formative, which is why this Government is making it a priority to make sure all children have the best start in le.ldquoSpeaking and communicating with confidence sets a child up for success in le, so itrsquos vital that we support children to grow in confidence with these skills ndash especially those for whom English is not their first language or who have been more isolated during the pandemic than their peers..push,i[r].l*new title: sanjeev gupta owner gfg alliance
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityThe SFO has announced a probe into suspected fraud and money laundering at GFG Alliance, which has thousands of staff in the UK, including at Liberty Steel.It is another twist in a long journey for Mr Gupta, who was born in India but was sent to boarding school in the UK when he was .An early starter, the businessman formed a chemicals trading business when he was at Cambridge University and was generating as much as pound million a day before he had graduated.He later branched out into buying steel mills, starting in Africa and Asia before turning his eye closer to home.Mr Gupta started forging his reputation in the UK when he bought a struggling steel mill in South Wales, saving it from likely collapse and rescuing jobs.He went on to relive this success several times, snapping up sites in the UKrsquos struggling steel industry and turning them around.Most famously his  deal with Tata Steel was estimated at the time to have saved around , jobs, earning him plaudits in the press as the ldquogreat hope of the British steel industry.GFG Alliance now employs , people in  countries, with revenues of around  billion dollarsa year.However the way it is financed has come under the microscope in recent years.Some old questions, and some new ones, were thrown into the spotlight when Greensill Capital collapsed in March.GFG used so-called supply chain finance services offered by Greensill. This meant thatGFG sold a product to a dferent company, it could send the invoice to Greensill and be paid right away, rather than having to wait potentially months for the customer to pay its bills.Bringing in money this way can be useful for companies with tight cash flows.However, how Greensill and GFG did business together is being investigated by fraud investigators.It is likely to spark renewed fears for the future of GFGrsquos employees.     .push,i[r].l*new Dateas,ms[]a.asynca.srcgmgagagagagagagagagagaga, title: Who is Sanjeev Gupta, the owner of GFG Alliance  article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: a simply breath taking home
story: Pope calls for rethink on towns   Council gives the go ahead to big plans for TandrageeNewsTraffic and TravelCrimeWeatherPoliticsBusinessEducationHealthPeopleRead ThisCoronavirusSportFootballOther SportWhats OnArts and EntertainmentThings To DoHomes and GardensLestyleCarsHomes and GardensPublic NoticesAdvertise My BusinessNewsPeopleA simply breath-taking homeThis property at  Newforge Road, Magheralin is without doubt one of the most desirable homes to come onto the market for sale in recent times.By The NewsroomFriday, th May , : am  "       "  It has been lovingly modernised, while at all times retaining many of the original features that one would expect from a property of its time. From the moment you step inside, the abundance of natural light is clearly evident, and runs right through the property. The recent extension to the rear is home to a breath-taking kitchen open plan to dining. ]]This elegantly designed section has a glass wall in addtion to glazes sliding doors leading onto the garden, and a trio of roof lanterns. The kitchen is the heart of every home, and this one benefits from an array of stylish cabinets and coordinating island with quartz countertop, further complimented by NEFF integrated appliances and an AGA range cooker. It lends itself naturally as a very sociable space, with the living room housing the multi fuel stove open plan to the dining area. There is an additional dual aspect drawing room with attractive open fire. On the first floor there are four generously proportioned bedrooms, and a family bathroom which can only be described as stunning. The suite comprises of a free-standing bath, walk in shower encloser and His and Hers twin basins with vanity unit, dual flush WC and heated towel rail. There is an additional bathroom ideal for guests to this home. Outside, the gardens are packed full of mature shrubs and trees providing the perfect haven for entertaining with complete privacy. Early viewing comes highly recommended to fully appreciate just how much this family home has to offer.Property details• Detached family home oozing with character• Four double bedrooms• Breath taking modern extension to rear with show stopping kitchen and walk-in pantry• Integrated NEFF appliances and beautul AGA range• Luxurious bathroom suite with free standing • Dual aspect drawing room with open fire• Living room with stove• Additional modern bathroom• Utility room and downstairs WC• Exquisite gardens packed full of mature shrubbery and trees, a haven to catch the sunshine• Generous private site in a sought after location  "       "  Most PopularCouncil gives the go ahead to big plans for TandrageeIdeas requested as campaign to rename Craigavon roundabouts launchedCo Armagh couple started fostering disabled children during pandemicSpot checks on pupils as NI principal reveals Snapchat used to get ‘zombie’ drug SpiceDoug Beattie: I have alienated loyalists but I don’t accept that loyalism equals paramilitarism - title: tesco launches new summer food collection for struggling families and children
story: Family and police ‘increasingly concerned’ for man missing since Sunday   Council gives the go ahead to big plans for TandrageeNewsTraffic and TravelCrimeWeatherPoliticsBusinessEducationHealthPeopleRead ThisCoronavirusSportFootballOther SportWhats OnArts and EntertainmentThings To DoHomes and GardensLestyleCarsHomes and GardensPublic NoticesAdvertise My BusinessNewsPeopleTesco launches new Summer Food Collection for struggling families and childrenTesco’s in Portadown is to hold an extra summer Food Collection for children and families.By Carmel RobinsonThursday, th May , : pm  "       "  This is a UK-wide initiative to support local families this summer.During the collection, which will take place in large Tesco stores from July  to  and in Express stores from July  to August , customers will be urged to donate long-le food to the Trussell Trust and FareShare to help them in their vital work to support families in communities across the UK. Tesco will again be topping up all customer donations with a % cash donation to the two charities.]]Donations are made at the launch of the Tesco Food Collection.Tesco UK  NI CEO Jason Tarry said: “Both the Trussell Trust and FareShare face extra demands during the summer, when children who would normally enjoy a healthy meal in school may miss out. That is why we have decided to hold this extra collection.”Charities FareShare and the Trussell Trust have welcomed the announcement.Emma Revie, Chief Executive of the Trussell Trust, added: “No one should face the indignity of needing emergency food. “Yet in the last year, food banks in our network provided record numbers of emergency food parcels to people struggling to afford the essentials. “This is not right but we know we can build a better future. “Thanks to the incredible ongoing generosity of Tesco, we are thrilled that customers will be able to support food banks during the Summer Food Collection. “Every donation makes such a dference and helps food banks in our network provide the best possible emergency support while we work together towards building a hunger free future,” said Emma.Spot checks on pupils as NI principal reveals Snapchat used to get ‘zombie’ drug Spice Read full story here--Editor’s Message:Thank you for reading this article.
